question: Which one among the following is the shortest route from Moscow to San Francisco?
option1: Moscow to Europe; crossing Atlantic and East coast of North America
option2: Over the North pole and over Canada and crossing Pacific
option3: Moscow to Siberia to Japan and crossing Pacific
answer: Moscow to Europe; crossing Atlantic and East coast of North America
explanation: The shortest route from Moscow to San Francisco is Moscow to Europe; crossing Atlantic and East Coast of North America. Moscow and Los Angeles show a longitude difference of 155 degree across the Atlantic and of 205 degree across the Pacific.
